then.line: I got this: a hydroplane!
Prota, you're supposed to be a Security Ace.
What do you think a hydroplane is?
I'm not sure, but I think it's got pontoons.
...Prota, you know I want you to go to the Festi-Ball right?
But that I need to administer this test because you jay-walked in front of me, The Mayoress?
Yes.
You understand I want you to do well, yes?
So that was the wrong answer?
Very much.
Rats.
Let's do one more. To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should...
The minimum speed at which cars hydroplane!
Which is...
I guess we'll see!
You guess we'll see.
Prota, that's not the right answer.
I think technically it is.
Hmmm...
I have to say. As the Mayoress, leader of Pomegranate Village, I despise this technicality.
But as a demonic entity governed by contract and covenant...I love this technicality.
Let's give it to you!
Yay!
Tell me: To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should...
I think it's 300 furlongs per hour?
300 furlongs. I haven't heard that unit of measurement in...decades. Perhaps centuries.
Maybe I'm the one taking you on a safe drive-- down memory lane!
I'm joking, I know I'm too young to drive. Please don't mark that as a mistake.
Well, you may be too young to drive, but you're not too young to answer correctly!
300 furlongs is about 35 miles per hour and that's exactly right!
Woohoo!
Now let's move on to the final question!
Tell me: To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should...
